paragraph.content: KEVIN GERARD HART MD - 04/21/2016 2:18 PM PDT

item.paragraph: Formatting of this note is different from the original. In 4 months: Get blood tests done at the lab when you are fasting for 12 hours. The lab is on the second floor of the hospital building. The order for the lab test will be in the computer. You may schedule an appointment by calling (510) 248-3996 or online at kp.org or you may just walk in. The lab is open Monday through Friday from 7AM to 7PM and on weekends from 7AM to Noon. I took the liberty of referring you for an appointment with general surgery for further evaluation of your peri anal fistula. You should expect a call from the department soon to schedule an appointment. Please let me know if you do not hear from the department within 1 week. Your Kaiser Permanente Care Instructions Well Visit: After Your Visit Your Care Instructions Physical exams can help you stay healthy. Your doctor has checked your overall health and may have suggested ways to take good care of yourself. He or she also may have recommended tests. At home, you can help prevent illness with healthy eating, regular exercise, and other steps. Follow-up care is a key part of your treatment and safety. Be sure to make and go to all appointments, and call your doctor if you are having problems. Its also a good idea to know your test results and keep a list of the medicines you take. How can you care for yourself at home? Reach and stay at a healthy weight. This will lower your risk for many problems, such as obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and high blood pressure. Eat 5 servings of fruits and vegetables every day. One serving is defined as:1 medium sized piece of fruit such as an apple, orange or banana. 1/2 cup of fresh, frozen or canned fruit. 1/2 cup of 100% fruit juice. 1 cup of raw leafy greens such as lettuce. 1/2 cup of cooked or raw vegetables or legumes such as beans or lentils Eat fish regularly - at least 8 ounces per week (one or two 4 ounce servings) Limit red meat (beef, pork or lamb) to one serving per week or less Try to follow a Mediterranean style diet including olive oil and nuts (walnuts, almonds, hazelnuts) You can find information about this type of diet from books and the Internet. Get at least 30 minutes of physical activity on most days of the week. Walking is a good choice. You also may want to do other activities, such as running, swimming, cycling, or playing tennis or team sports. Discuss any changes in your exercise program with your doctor. ______________________________________________________________________________________ Eat Oatmeal every day. Improving your diet is the number one most important thing that most people can do for better health. A whole-food, plant-based diet is a powerful tool in helping you meet your health goals, feel better and live life richly. Plant-Based Diet Booklet ______________________________________________________________________ Video - What Do You Eat on a Plant-Based Diet? ______________________________________________________________________ The movie Forks Over Knives shares an unhealthy reporter's exploration of lifestyle that transforms his own existence. It is a feature film that examines the profound claim that most degenerative diseases that afflict us can be controlled or even reversed by rejecting animal-based and processed foods. Also, the movie "Food Inc." is very good about the current food supply. Sugar: The Bitter Truth Below are my top book picks: The Omnivore's Dilemma, by Michael Pollan is a very entertaining book about the nature of food and our current food supply. If you are interested mostly in weight loss..... "Eat to Live", by Dr. Joel Furhman. Read Chapter 8 first - see if you can do it or want to follow the plan. If so, then read the rest of the book for information on why this works. For General Health Improvement with plant-based diet , The Engine 2 Diet, by Rip Esselstyn, is a fun read, with myth busters and delicious, easy recipes. It shares plant-based eating experiences from elite athletes, fire fighters and ordinary couch potatoes. ______________________________________________________________________ For anyone with a history of heart attack, stroke or vascular disease: Prevent and Reverse Heart Disease, by Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn of the Cleveland Clinic, is a great book for people who may have cardiovascular disease, heart attack or stroke, and provides recipes and research about how and why a plant-based diet can reverse these diseases.
Electronically signed by KEVIN GERARD HART MD at 04/21/2016 2:37 PM PDT

item.caption: KEVIN GERARD HART MD - 04/21/2016 2:17 PM PDT
item.paragraph:
Formatting of this note is different from the original.
Manav Agarwal is a 29 Y male is here for a routine complete physical examination.
He also has the additional complaint of follow up on perirectal abscess surgery. Still draining off and on over the last year.
Has several lab abnormalities.
Complains of not sleeping well, difficulty falling asleep and getting back to sleep if wakes.

FLUoxetine (PROzac) 10 mg Oral Cap Take 2 capsules orally in the morning
